results.title: Noblessner – the new life of an old shipyard - Visit Tallinn
results.content: Visitor  Ideas & tips  All tips, articles & guides   Noblessner – the new life of an old shipyard # Noblessner – the new life of an old shipyard The old factory halls have woken up to a new life and the car-free streets are bustling with art galleries, shops, an active visitor marina, sea view restaurants – and there’s still more to come as we speak. Noblessner is also home to some fascinating galleries - Temnikova & Kasela Gallery concentrates on art and artists from Estonia and its neighbouring countries. The Noblessner marina is home to an amazing Iglupark, combining urban city life, land and sea, saunas, luxurious accommodation and rentable office spaces. All restaurants and bars can be found on Noblessner’s website.

results.title: A versatile port city - Noblessner
results.content: Noblessner, recognised as the best urban development in the Baltic countries, is situated by the sea, within a walking distance from Tallinn city centre and the Old Town. Kodusadam OÜ announces an open architectural competition for seaside buildings and urban space in Noblessner, Tallinn. * ### Ironman Tallinn in Noblessner 7 and 8 August 2021 ## Noblessner is located in Tallinn’s seaside Noblessner is Tallinn’s first district that is open to the sea and is very likely to please many people who enjoy life by the sea, close to the city centre, surrounded by culture venues, good restaurants and summertime seaside and city bustle. * About Noblessner
